CHARM: An object, act or words believed to have magic power (usually carries a positive connotation).
CHEERIO: A small saveloy often consumed with tomato sauce at parties.
CRUNCH: A noisy crackling sound; the sound usually associated with ______ing.
FLAKE: A loose filmy mass or a thin chiplike layer of anything
LOOP: A length of thread, line or rope that is doubled over to make an opening.
PEBBLE: A small stone, especially one rounded by the action of water.
PUFF: The product of flatulence, or the sound of breaking wind.
SMACK: A distinct flavor, especially if slight.
